briefTitle: Long-term Safety and Efficacy Study of Teduglutide in Pediatric Participants With Short Bowel Syndrome (SBS)
officialTitle: A Prospective, Open-label, Long-term Safety and Efficacy Study of Teduglutide in Pediatric Patients With Short Bowel Syndrome Who Completed TED-C14-006 or SHP633-301
summary: This study will follow participants who completed the TED-C14-006 study. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of teduglutide in pediatric participants with Short Bowel Syndrome (SBS). This study will also offer teduglutide treatment to eligible participants, regardless of treatment received in TED-C14-006 or SHP633-301.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From start of study drug administration up to follow-up (up to 46 months)
